intro: Allamanda schottii, commonly known as the yellow allamanda, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant has smooth, glossy, dark green leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Allamanda schottii is noted for its rapid growth and ability to produce abundant blooms throughout the growing season.
